title: Graving Dock
description:
‘Graving dock’ is another phrase for ‘dry dock’; to ‘grave’ something is to lay it down.

The graving dock survived the explosion, with very little damage. This photograph is from the Nova Scotia Archives, Notman Studio collection, and shows the graving dock just after the explosion.

The graving dock is a National Engineers’ Historic Site, however no photos can be taken at this site since it is still in use.
